properties.areaDesc: Bitterroot/Sapphire Mountains; Lower Clark Fork Region
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 7 at 2:00PM MST until February 8 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Missoula MT
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulation 6-12 inches above 4500
feet. Mixed precipitation expected below 4500 feet. Ice
accumulation of a light glaze expected. Winds gusting as high
as 35 mph.

* WHERE...Evaro Hill, Highway 200 Thompson Falls to Plains,
Highway 200 Trout Creek to Heron, I-90 Lookout Pass to Haugan,
Highway 93 Sula to Lost Trail Pass, and Lolo Pass.

* WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 5 PM MST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be affected. Areas of blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST SATURDAY
